name: Junie Fluid Text
author: Romeo B. Asis jr

sections.description: This WP Plugin adds fluidity on all HTML Text Elements (ie: H1, H2, H3) to get along with your responsive wordpress site.
sections.installation:
Requirements

  • PHP version 5.3.0 or greater.
  • WordPress version 3.3 or greater.

Install

  1. Upload the ‘fluidtext’ folder to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Go to Settings -> Fluid Text and start adding html elements in the textbox.

How To Use

Use vw in fontsize in your css code for example: h1 (font-size: 3vw);

Uninstall

  1. Deactivate Fluid Text in the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  2. Select Fluid Text in the ‘Recently Active Plugins’ section and select ‘Delete’ from the ‘Bulk Actions’ drop down menu.
  3. This will delete all the plugin files from the server as well as erasing all options the plugin has stored in the database.
sections.faq:
Why I need to install this plugin?

Making a Responsive WP site, Big Texts are Hard to adapt the responsive screen sizes. you need to add min-widths and max-widths css rules, sometimes very bulky for a css file. installing this plugin, your HTML Texts will automatically adapts on screen sizes without any additional css coding.
